text: some Guantanamo detainees freed a
stranded ship in an Arctic ice and Mayor
Bloomberg's legacy happy new year this
is the New York Times minute a step
towards closing the Guantanamo Bay
prison the US military released three
Chinese detainees to Slovakia the ethnic
wiegers a Muslim minority from China
were captured in the 2001 invasion of
Afghanistan a judge had ordered them
free in 2008 but they remained until now
because of difficulty in finding a place
to send them a third attempt to reach an
icebound Russian ship off Antarctica as
possible tonight passengers stomped on
the snow to prepare for a helicopter
rescue an Australian icebreaker failed
to reach the ship yesterday the ship has
been trapped in the ice is Christmas Eve
and today's new york mayor michael
bloomberg's last day in office is
lasting legacy sweeping changes in
health crime wealth and democracy
including education his number one
priority he abolished the old Board of
Education and took direct control of the
city school system mr. Bloomberg served
12 years in office
